meanings.definition: To cover (a roof or building) with new shingles.
meanings.sent1: The roofers reshingled the old house to protect it from rain.
meanings.sent2: We reshingled our cabin last summer to keep it looking nice.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels decided to reshingle their treehouse for a fresh new look.
meanings.sent4: The idea of reshingling our home with colorful shingles excited us.
meanings.sent5: The sound of reshingling echoed through the neighborhood, signaling a renovation.

meanings.definition: To replace the shingles on (a roof or building) with new ones.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, we had to reshingle the entire roof to fix the damage.
meanings.sent2: The contractor reshingled the building quickly to prevent any leaks.
meanings.sent3: The birds watched curiously as we reshingled the birdhouse in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The decision to reshingle the barn was like giving it a fresh coat of paint.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh shingles filled the air as we reshingled the gazebo.
